net.canarymod.api.ai

Interface AIBase

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AIArrowAttack, AIAttackOnCollide, AIAvoidEntity, AIBeg, AIBreakDoor, AIControlledByPlayer, AICreeperSwell, AIDefendVillage, AIDoorInteract, AIEatGrass, AIFindEntityNearest, AIFindEntityNearestPlayer, AIFleeSun, AIFollowGolem, AIFollowOwner, AIFollowParent, AIHarvestFarmland, AIHurtByTarget, AILeapAtTarget, AILookAtTradePlayer, AILookAtVillager, AILookIdle, AIMate, AIMoveIndoors, AIMoveThroughVillage, AIMoveToBlock, AIMoveTowardsRestriction, AIMoveTowardsTarget, AINearestAttackableTarget, AIOcelotAttack, AIOcelotSit, AIOpenDoor, AIOwnerHurtByTarget, AIOwnerHurtTarget, AIPanic, AIPlay, AIRestrictOpenDoor, AIRestrictSun, AIRunAroundLikeCrazy, AISit, AISwimming, AITarget, AITargetNonTamed, AITempt, AITradePlayer, AIVillagerInteract, AIVillagerMate, AIWander, AIWatchClosest, AIWatchClosest2

    public interface AIBase
    This class executes AI tasks on a Living Entity based on the following Logic. To use this, create a class implementing it and then add it to an entity via AIManager.
    Author:
    Aaron (somners)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean continueExecuting()
      Returns whether an in-progress AIBase should continue executing
      boolean isContinuous()
      Returns whether the task requires multiple updates or not
      void resetTask()
      Resets the task
      boolean shouldExecute()
      Returns whether the AIBase should begin execution.
      void startExecuting()
      Execute a one shot task or start executing a continuous task
      void updateTask()
      Updates the task.
      This is called on ticks following the tick where AIBase.startExecuting() is called until AIBase.resetTask() is called.

    • Method Detail

      • shouldExecute

        boolean shouldExecute()
        Returns whether the AIBase should begin execution.
        Returns:
        true if the manager should execute this, false otherwise.

      • continueExecuting

        boolean continueExecuting()
        Returns whether an in-progress AIBase should continue executing
        Returns:
        true if the manager should continue executing this, false otherwise.

      • isContinuous

        boolean isContinuous()
        Returns whether the task requires multiple updates or not
        Returns:
        true means this takes multiple ticks to execute, false otherwise.

      • startExecuting

        void startExecuting()
        Execute a one shot task or start executing a continuous task

      • resetTask

        void resetTask()
        Resets the task

      • updateTask

        void updateTask()
        Updates the task.
        This is called on ticks following the tick where AIBase.startExecuting() is called until AIBase.resetTask() is called.
